name: tree-extended
description: Extension for getting the text tree for a directory with a lot of options

treeExtended.showNotEmptyDirectoryIndica.description: When the directory tree is pruned at the maximum deep we can show an indicator ('...') which means the directory is not empty

treeExtended.charset.description: Charset used to render the directory tree
enumDescriptions: Ascii classic charset. Compatible with old system and consoles
Utf8 charset. Use other characters that are not defined in ascii which make it better to understand
Utf8 with icons. Same characters than utf8, but also include fancy icons to easily differentiate between directories and files

treeExtended.gitignore.description: Ignore files and directories defined in the .gitignore file

treeExtended.default.maxLevel.description: The default maximum deep level the generated directory tree will have

treeExtended.default.ignore.description: Filter to exclude folders or files in an optional tree level, e.g.: 'window, 0:red cat, 1:blue sky'
treeExtended.default.ignore.markdownDescription: Filter to exclude folders or files in an optional tree level. Pattern: `[level1:]folder/file name1,  [level2:]folder/file name2, ...`, e.g.: `window, 0:red cat, 1:blue sky`. See more details and examples at [tree-extended](https://www.npmjs.com/package/tree-extended)

treeExtended.default.only.description: Filter to only include folders or files in an optional tree level, e.g.: 'window, 0:red cat, 1:blue sky'
treeExtended.default.only.markdownDescription: Filter to only include folders or files in an optional tree level. Pattern: `[level1:]folder/file name1,  [level2:]folder/file name2, ...`, e.g.: `window, 0:red cat, 1:blue sky`. See more details and examples at [tree-extended](https://www.npmjs.com/package/tree-extended)

scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
